page.title: 08Laverstock Primary School.
page.content: The original parish school was founded in 1861 for the children of the parish of Laverstock, and sited on the south side of the village green. It was establihed as a National School in its present building in 1880 to accomodate 84 children in just two classrooms - one large, and one small one for the Infants.{In 1944 it was granted {'Aided' Status to serve the pupils of {the Parish of Laverstock.}In 1963 it was enlarged and during the last decade admitted over 150 pupils. Falling roll bring it to its present size of 62 pupils.During the past 105 years there have been 7 headteachers. There is a reference library and over one thousand story books. The school has 2 complete micro computer systems and is well provided with materials for the normal day to day activities and works closely with other schools.
